properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: There is a cluster of slow moving thunderstorms south of Sarnia, over Oil Springs and Petrolia. Radar estimates of 30 to 40 mm of rainfall has already fallen in some locales. Total amounts up to 50 mm are expected in isolated areas. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-18T08:42:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-18T05:44:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3621615921.2019
Area: Watford - Pinery Park - Eastern Lambton County, Sarnia - Petrolia - Western Lambton County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. The severe thunderstorm threat will end near midnight. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-08-18T07:59:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-18T02:35:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2061159760.2019

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. Total rainfall amounts of 50 to 75 mm are expected. Rainfall amounts of 40 to 55 mm have been reported so far with a further 5 to 10 mm forecast by Sunday morning. Periods of rain are expected to linger across northern Saskatchewan through Sunday. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-18T13:56:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-17T21:57:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3364440909.2019
Area: Cree Lake - Key Lake, Wollaston Lake - Collins Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. In total, rainfall amounts of 50 to 75 mm are expected. Rainfall amounts of 30 to 45 mm have been reported so far with a further 15 to 30 mm forecast by Sunday morning. Periods of rain are expected to linger across northern Saskatchewan through Sunday. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long period of snowfall with total amounts of 20 to 30 cm is expected. Early-season heavy snow for part of the Alaska Highway tonight and Sunday. The combination of an unseasonably cold arctic airmass invading from the north and Pacific moisture associated with a low on the North Coast will result in heavy snow at higher elevations between Fort Nelson and Watson Lake. Total snowfall amounts of 20 to 30 cm are expected by late Sunday. The town of Fort Nelson should have just rain through the period. The heavy snow is forecast to end by Monday morning. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Heavy snowfall accumulation may cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-18T20:08:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-18T04:09:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0484276790.2019
Area: Fort Nelson
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Summary:
Description: A long period of snowfall with total amounts of 20 to 30 cm is expected. Early-season heavy snow for part of the Alaska Highway tonight and Sunday. The combination of an unseasonably cold arctic airmass invading from the north and Pacific moisture associated with a low on the North Coast will result in heavy snow at higher elevations between Fort Nelson and Watson Lake. Total snowfall amounts of 20 to 30 cm are expected by late Sunday. The town of Fort Nelson should have just rain through the period. The heavy snow is forecast to end by Monday morning. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Heavy snowfall accumulation may cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
